name: searxng
desc: Fork of Searx, a privacy-respecting, hackable metasearch engine

options.name: enable
options.desc: Whether to enable Searx, the meta search engine.

options.name: environmentFile
options.desc: Environment file (see systemd.exec(5) “EnvironmentFile=” section for the syntax) to define variables for Searx. This option can be used to safely include secret keys into the Searx configuration.

options.name: limiterSettings
options.desc: Limiter settings for SearXNG.  For available settings, see the SearXNG schema file.

options.name: redisCreateLocally
options.desc: Configure a local Redis server for SearXNG. This is required if you want to enable the rate limiter and bot protection of SearXNG.

options.name: runInUwsgi
options.desc: Whether to run searx in uWSGI as a “vassal”, instead of using its built-in HTTP server. This is the recommended mode for public or large instances, but is unnecessary for LAN or local-only use.  The built-in HTTP server logs all queries by default.

options.name: settings
options.desc: Searx settings. These will be merged with (taking precedence over) the default configuration. It’s also possible to refer to environment variables (defined in services.searx.environmentFile) using the syntax @VARIABLE_NAME@.  For available settings, see the Searx docs.

options.name: settingsFile
options.desc: The path of the Searx server settings.yml file. If no file is specified, a default file is used (default config file has debug mode enabled). Note: setting this options overrides services.searx.settings.  This file, along with any secret key it contains, will be copied into the world-readable Nix store.

options.name: uwsgiConfig
options.desc: Additional configuration of the uWSGI vassal running searx. It should notably specify on which interfaces and ports the vassal should listen.
